li.p: Definitions
"Contributor" means each individual or legal entity that creates, contributes to the creation of, or owns Covered Software.
"Contributor Version" means the combination of the Contributions of others (if any) used by a Contributor and that particular Contributor's Contribution.

list.li: a.That the initial Contributor has attached the notice described in Exhibit B to the Covered Software; or
b.that the Covered Software was made available under the terms of version 1.x or earlier of the License, but not also under the terms of a Secondary License.

li.p: "Executable Form" means any form of the work other than Source Code Form.
"Larger Work" means a work that combines Covered Software with other material, in a separate file (or files) that is not Covered Software.
"License" means this document.
"Licensable" means having the right to grant, to the maximum extent possible, whether at the time of the initial grant or subsequently, any and all of the rights conveyed by this License.
"Modifications" means any of the following:

list.li: a.any file in Source Code Form that results from an addition to, deletion from, or modification of the contents of Covered Software; or
b.any new file in Source Code Form that contains any Covered Software.

li.p: "Patent Claims" of a Contributor means any patent claim(s), including without limitation, method, process, and apparatus claims, in any patent Licensable by such Contributor that would be infringed, but for the grant of the License, by the making, using, selling, offering for sale, having made, import, or transfer of either its Contributions or its Contributor Version.

"Source Code Form" means the form of the work preferred for making modifications.

"You" (or "Your") means an individual or a legal entity exercising rights under this License. For legal entities, "You" includes any entity that controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with You. For purposes of this definition, "control" means:

list.li: (a) the power, direct or indirect, to cause the direction or management of such entity, whether by contract or otherwise, or
(b) ownership of more than fifty percent (50%) of the outstanding shares or beneficial ownership of such entity.
